tit.cmt: 他の「建造物」ファイルの表記に合せて訂正しました。

sen.j: 梅山古墳（うめやまこふん）は奈良県高市郡明日香村にある古墳。
sen.e: Umeyama Kofun (梅山古墳) is a tumulus which lies at Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Umeyama Tumulus lies at Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 他の「建造物」ファイルの表記に合せて訂正しました。
sen.e: Umeyama Tumulus lies at Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 宮内庁によって欽明天皇陵（檜隈坂合陵）に指定されている。
sen.e: It is designated as the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei (Hinokuma no saka Ai no Misasagi) by the Imperial Household Agency.
It is designated as the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei (Hinokuma no saka Ai no Misasagi) by the Imperial Household Agency.
It is designated as the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei (Hinokuma no saka Ai no Misasagi) by the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 墳丘は前方部を西に向け東西に正確に主軸をとった前方後円墳で、全長約140m 後円部径72mで、明日香村内では最大の古墳である。
sen.e: The tumulus is a zenpo-koen-fun(前方後円墳, large keyhole-shaped tomb mound) with the front square part facing west and with the principal axis running exactly from east to west, whose total length was 140 meters with its rear round part being 72 meters in diameter, and it is the largest tumulus in Asuka-mura.

The tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound with the front square part facing west and with the principal axis running exactly from east to west, whose total length was 140 meters with its rear round part being 72 meters in diameter, and it is the largest tumulus in Asuka-mura.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記と、日本語読みは不要と考え削除しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound with the front square part facing west and with the principal axis running exactly from east to west, whose total length was 140 meters with its rear round part being 72 meters in diameter, and it is the largest tumulus in Asuka-mura.

sen.j: 非常に多くの葺石があることでも知られている。
sen.e: It is also well known because a great many fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb) are scattered around.
It is also well known because a great many fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb) are scattered around.
It is also well known because a great many fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb) are scattered around.

sen.j: 現在は回りに水を湛えた周濠を持っているが、これは文久の修復で大幅に改築されたものであり元は田であった。
sen.e: At present the tumulus is surrounded by moats full of water, but this is a result of the drastic reconstruction by restoration in the Bunkyu era, and before that it had been surrounded by rice fields.

At present the tumulus is surrounded by moats full of water, but this is a result of the drastic reconstruction by restoration in the Bunkyu era, and before that it had been surrounded by rice fields.

At present the tumulus is surrounded by moats full of water, but this is a result of the drastic reconstruction by restoration in the Bunkyu era, and before that it had been surrounded by rice fields.

sen.j: なお、この修復の際に双円墳から前方後円墳に改造されたとする考えもある。
sen.e: By the way, some people have a view that the tumulus was renovated from soen-fun (双円墳, double round-shaped tomb mound) to zenpo-koen-fun during this restoration.
By the way, some people have a view that the tumulus was renovated from a double round-shaped tomb mound to a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound during this restoration.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記と、日本語読みは不要と考え削除しました。a 補足しました。前出の表記に合せました。
sen.e: By the way, some people have a view that the tumulus was renovated from a double round-shaped tomb mound to a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound during this restoration.

sen.j: 同古墳と平田岩屋古墳、鬼の爼・鬼の雪隠古墳、野口王墓（天武・持統合葬陵）は同じ丘陵の南側の地形を利用して造られており、4つの古墳が東西に並んでいる。
sen.e: This Umeyama Kofun, Hirata Iwaya Kofun (Hirata Iwaya Tumulus), Oni no Manaita and Oni no Secchin Kofun (Ogre's Cutting Board and Ogre's Toilet Tumulus), and Noguchio no Haka (Noguchio's Tomb, that is Joint Mausoleum of Emperor Tenmu and Jito) have been constructed using the southern topography of the same hills, and these four tumuli are aligned from east to west.

This Umeyama Tumulus, Hirata Iwaya Tumulus, Oni no Manaita (ogre's cutting board) and Oni no Secchin (Ogre's Toilet) Tumulus, and Noguchio no Haka (Prince Noguchi's Tomb, that is Joint Mausoleum of Emperor Tenmu and Jito) have been constructed using the southern topography of the same hills, and these four tumuli are aligned from east to west.
sen.cmt: Tumulusに訂正しました。説明括弧の位置を訂正しました。Prince Noguchi's Tombに訂正しました。
sen.e: This Umeyama Tumulus, Hirata Iwaya Tumulus, Oni no Manaita (ogre's cutting board) and Oni no Secchin (Ogre's Toilet) Tumulus, and Noguchio no Haka (Prince Noguchi's Tomb, that is Joint Mausoleum of Emperor Tenmu and Jito) have been constructed using the southern topography of the same hills, and these four tumuli are aligned from east to west.

sen.j: 古墳時代後期の築造とみられているが、発掘調査が行われていないため正確な築造時期を推定することは難しい。
sen.e: It is thought that Umeyama Kofun was constructed in the late Kofun period, but because the excavation and research has not been carried out, it is difficult to estimate exactly when it was constructed.

It is thought that Umeyama Tumulus was constructed in the late Tumulus period, but because the excavation and research has not been carried out, it is difficult to estimate exactly when it was constructed.

It is thought that Umeyama Tumulus was constructed in the late Tumulus period, but because the excavation and research has not been carried out, it is difficult to estimate exactly when it was constructed.

sen.j: 宮内庁によって欽明天皇陵とされているが、梅山古墳から北西に約800m行った所にある奈良県下最大の古墳の見瀬丸山古墳を欽明天皇陵とする学説も多い。
sen.e: Umeyama Kofun is designated as the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei by the Imperial Household Agency, but there are also many theories that connect the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei to Mise Maruyama Kofun which lies about 800 meters to the northwest of Umeyama Kofun and is the largest tumulus in Nara Prefecture.

Umeyama Tumulus is designated as the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei by the Imperial Household Agency, but there are also many theories that connect the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei to Mise Maruyama Tumulus which lies about 800 meters to the northwest of Umeyama Tumulus and is the largest tumulus in Nara Prefecture.

Umeyama Tumulus is designated as the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei by the Imperial Household Agency, but there are also many theories that connect the burial mound of Emperor Kinmei to Mise Maruyama Tumulus which lies about 800 meters to the northwest of Umeyama Tumulus and is the largest tumulus in Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 梅山古墳の埋葬者については蘇我稲目とする考えもある。
sen.e: Besides, there is an opinion that SOGA no Iname was buried in Umeyama Kofun.
Besides, there is an opinion that SOGA no Iname was buried in Umeyama Tumulus.
Besides, there is an opinion that SOGA no Iname was buried in Umeyama Tumulus.

sen.j: 隣接する吉備姫王墓に猿石と呼ばれる石像物が置かれているが、これは江戸時代に梅山古墳のすぐ南の田（小字池田）で掘り出されて古墳のかたわらに置かれていたもので、明治初期に現在の場所に移された。
sen.e: A stone statue called Saruishi, which is placed in the adjoining tomb of Kibitsuhime Okimi, was dug out from the rice field (Koaza Ikeda) just to the south of Umeyama Kofun in the Edo period and had been placed beside the kofun since then, but in the early Meiji period it was moved to the present spot.

A stone statue called Saruishi, which is placed in the adjoining tomb of Kibitsuhime Okimi, was dug out from the rice field (Koaza Ikeda) just to the south of Umeyama Tumulus in the Edo period and had been placed beside the tumulus since then, but in the early Meiji period it was moved to the present spot.

A stone statue called Saruishi, which is placed in the adjoining tomb of Kibitsuhime Okimi, was dug out from the rice field (Koaza Ikeda) just to the south of Umeyama Tumulus in the Edo period and had been placed beside the tumulus since then, but in the early Meiji period it was moved to the present spot.
